Perf Tooling Today

#monitoring

  • DOM Monster

    “DOM Monster is our answer to JavaScript performance tools that just don’t give you the full picture.

    DOM Monster is a cross-platform, cross-browser bookmarklet that will analyze the DOM & other features of the page you’re on, and give you its bill of health.”

    • Bookmarklet

  • API Benchmark

    “A grunt plugin based on the nodejs module api-benchmark that takes a config.json file like this, makes some performance tests to your api, and creates an html export.”

    • Grunt plugin

  • browser-perf

    “Is a NodeJS based tool or measuring browser performance metrics (like layout, paint, dom load or frame times).

    It collects the metrics from sources like about:tracing, Chrome Devtools timeline, IE UI Responsiveness tab, Xperf, etc.”

    • CLI

  • Browsertime

    “Fetch timings (Navigation Timing API and User Timing) and other data from your browser!”

    • CLI

  • Calibre

    “Performance, covered.

    Calibre tracks how long your pages take to load, how big or small your pages are becoming as well as browser scroll performance. Janky page? Youâ€™ll know about it straight away.”

    • Service

  • CSSStats

    “cssstats.com is a css visualizer.”

    • Service

  • DevPerf

    “Helps front-end developers to reach a good quality and good performances, based on phantomas and grunt-phantomas.

    Day after day, while working on your project, keep an eye on performance metrics and get warnings for things you should optimize.”

    • Grunt plugin

  • New Relic

    “New Relic gets you immediate code-level visibility to build faster software, create better products, and delight your customers.”

    • Service

  • PageSpeed Insights

    “PageSpeed Insights products will help you identify performance best practices that can be applied to your site, and PageSpeed optimization tools can help you automate the process.”

    • Service
    • CLI
    • Node module
    • Grunt plugin
    • gulp plugin

  • Parker

    “Parker is a stylesheet analysis tool. It runs metrics on your stylesheets and will report on their complexity.”

    • CLI

  • PerfBudget

    “grunt-perfbudget is a Grunt.js task for enforcing a performance budget (more on performance budgets).

    It uses the wonderful webpagetest.org and the WebPagetest API Wrapper for NodeJS created by Marcel Duran.”

    • Grunt plugin

  • Perfmonkey

    “PerfMonkey makes it very simple to keep track of your website’s rendering performance.”

    • Service

  • Phantomas

    “PhantomJS-based modular web performance metrics collector.”

    • CLI
    • Node module
    • Grunt plugin

  • sitespeed.io

    “Sitespeed.io is an open source tool that helps you analyze your website speed and performance based on performance best practices and metrics.

    It collects data from multiple pages on your website, analyze the pages using the rules and output the result as HTML or JUnit XML.”

    • CLI

  • SpeedCurve

    “Monitor front-end performance. Beat the competition.

    Get continuous feedback on how your front-end code is affecting the performance of your website.”

    • Service

  • stress css

    “This project is a bookmarklet for stress testing the CSS on any given webpage.

    It indexes all the elements and their classes, and then–class by class–it removes one, and times how long it takes to scroll the page. Selectors that save a considerable amount of time when removed indicate problem areas.”

    • Bookmarklet

  • StyleStats

    “StyleStats is a Node.js library to collect CSS statistics.”

    • Service
    • CLI
    • Node module
    • Grunt plugin
    • gulp plugin

  • uCSS

    “uCSS is made for crawling (large) websites to find unused CSS selectors.”

    • CLI
    • Grunt plugin

  • WEBPAGETEST

    “Run a free website speed test from multiple locations around the globe using real browsers and at real consumer connection speeds. You can run simple tests or perform advanced testing including video capture, content blocking and more.

    Results will provide rich diagnostic information including a lot of suggestions for improvements.”

    • Service
    • Grunt plugin

  • webperf-monitor

    “At the moment this is a CLI tool for stashing a pagespeed insights score for each URL retrieved from a sitemap.”

    • CLI

  • YSlow

    “YSlow for Command Line runs on Node.JS and requires a HAR file as input source in order to analyze page performance.”

    • CLI

  • speedreport

    “Measure page asset download times, find unused CSS rules and find which CSS rules are in your critical rendering path with PhantomJS.”

    • CLI

  • CSSCSS

    “csscss will parse any CSS files you give it and let you know which rulesets have duplicated declarations.”

    • Node module
    • Grunt plugin
    • gulp plugin

  • perfBar

    “Simple way to collect and look at your website performance metrics quickly, that supports budgeting and adding custom metrics.”

    • Script

  • DareBoost

    “DareBoost offers performance analysis and monitoring (real browsers). It integrates Google Page Speed, YSlow, W3C validators and its own best practices, with tailor-made tips on specific technologies like jQuery, WordPress, etc”

    • Service

  • PerfJankie

    “PerfJankie uses browser-perf to measure browser rendering performance metrics and tabulate the results in a CouchDB database.

    It is a node module available as perfjankie and can be integrated into any continuous integration system.”

    • Node module

#automatization

  • CSSShrink

    “CSS minifier

    Because CSS is on the critical path to rendering pages. It must be small! Or else!”

    • Node module
    • Grunt plugin
    • gulp plugin

  • Uglify2

    “UglifyJS is a JavaScript parser, minifier, compressor or beautifier toolkit.””

    • CLI
    • Node module
    • Grunt plugin
    • gulp plugin

  • clean-css

    “Clean-css is a fast and efficient Node.js library for minifying CSS files.

    According to tests it is one of the best available.”

    • CLI
    • Node module
    • Grunt plugin
    • gulp plugin

  • HTMLMinifier

    “HTMLMinifier is a highly configurable, well-tested, Javascript-based HTML minifier, with lint-like capabilities.”

    • Node module
    • Grunt plugin
    • gulp plugin

  • imagemin

    “Minify images seamlessly with Node.js.”

    • CLI
    • Node module
    • Grunt plugin
    • gulp plugin

Brought to you by the performance community
